sub_title: Researcher Tissue Culture and Cell Biology at Bejo Zaden
summary: I have a deep interest in the genetic underpinnings of development. How are specific alterations of the genetic code exactly linked to changed properties of an organism, such as size, shape or physiology? During my PhD and postdoc I have been well trained in studying these problems. Now, my ambition is to move to the field of applied plant research. In doing so, I feel I will be able to combine my scientific interests with solving the major challenges that our society faces; cultivating crops in a world undergoing climate change and bearing an ever increasing population size.

My project focused on unraveling the function and evolutionary conservation of the rco gene in leaf serration formation in plants.', 'title': 'Postdoctoral Research Fellow', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 483390, 'name': 'Hubrecht Institute, Developmental Biology and Stem Cell Research', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQGuztpN-KV32w/company-logo_400_400/0/1522257728953?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=HBeVmlg1NgpvZLthSWSmKhVRn-2EujljPh3Q5W4q6Ws', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/hubrecht-institute-developmental-biology-and-stem-cell-research/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Utrecht, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Hubrecht Institute, Developmental Biology and Stem Cell Research', 'description': 'Thesis title: "Uncovering Wnt signaling mechanisms in control of cell migration in C. elegans". 

In the group of prof. dr. Rik Korswagen I studied the role of Wnt signaling in neuroblast migration during the first larval stage of C. elegans development. Wnt signaling has important roles in the guidance of cells and axons during development of the vertebrate nervous system. The great number of Wnt ligand and receptor homologues in vertebrates has however hampered the study of their precise functions, due to the complexity of the system. 

Therefore I have used the much more simplified model organism C. elegans to study Wnt signaling. I investigated the migration of two bilateral Q neuroblasts - QL and QR - and their descendants (Qx.d). The posterior migration of the QL.d is controlled by a canonical Wnt signaling pathway, while a non-canonical pathway controls the anterior migration of the QR.d. This system provides a powerful platform which allows the precise study of different Wnt signaling pathways at the single cell level across many individual animals. 

Main techniques: (Spinning disc) Confocal microscopy, single molecule Fluorescence in situ Hybridization, DIC microscopy, Fluorescence microscopy, molecular cloning, PCR, microinjection, western blot, immunoprecipitation, immunostaining, cell culture, C. elegans culture.', 'title': 'PhD student', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 162886, 'name': 'Cancer Research UK', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQEvOv-Hb3wAiQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1688653528439?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=7EgOF45Vxa1xLE3o2vKT73u7qW7-qHjuMtPwxDnhQY0', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/cancer-research-uk/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Cambridge, United Kingdom', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Cancer Research UK (CRUK)', 'description': 'Internship in the lab of prof. Fiona Watt (Epithelial Biology). I investigated the mechanism of spontaneous papilloma formation after wounding in the hyperproliferative skin of a transgenic mouse. Main techniques: FACS, immunostaining, western blot, protease activity assays, primary cell culture.', 'title': 'Intern', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Plant Research International', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Wageningen, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Plant Research International', 'description': 'Internship in the laboratory of Plant physiology.
